Data: Starc to Shehzad, 1 run short of a length, just outside off, runs it down to third man to get off the mark right away
Starc to Sarfaraz, no run Sarfraz is not walking down the wicket to Starc here. Stays in the crease to defend a length ball
Starc to Sarfaraz, no run he moves back into the crease but the intent is positive. Drives at a length ball, Smith at cover-point makes a diving save

Starc to Sarfaraz, no run this one swings. Sarfraz, who has walked down to Philander, Steyn etc. so far, is caught with his feet stuck. This one swings a touch back in from outside off. He pushes away from the body. Beaten on the inside edge. Off stump stays safe
Starc to Sarfaraz, no run bouncer, 150ks already, he ducks it
Starc to Sarfaraz, no run wide length ball, driven on the up, but straight to Smith at cover-point
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run outswinger, just outside off, on a length, left alone
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run good outswing, against the angle, left alone just outside off
Hazlewood to Shehzad, 1 run short of a length, outside off, opens the face for a single
Hazlewood to Sarfaraz, no run Sarf walks down this time. Hazlewood digs it in. He has to defend off the back foot
Hazlewood to Sarfaraz, 4 leg byes too straight. Sarf is down the wicket again, Hazlewood strays down the pads, and kisses the pad on the way for four leg-byes
Hazlewood to Sarfaraz, no run short of a length, seams away from just outside off, Sarf wafts at it, and is beaten
Starc to Shehzad, no run lovely delivery. Looks like it will swing back in, pitches just outside off, and then seams away to beat the outside edge
Starc to Shehzad, 1 run goes for the yorker already, ends up bowling a low full toss at 150ks, the ball runs off the outside half of the bat for one
Starc to Sarfaraz, no run short of a length, middle and leg, defended to midwicket. 149ks this time
Starc to Sarfaraz, 2 runs on the pads this time, and Sarfraz is off the mark with a clip fine of long leg
Starc to Sarfaraz, 1 run digs this one in short, Sarf goes tall, cuts this to third man for one

Starc to Shehzad, 2 runs nicely played. Shehzad upper-cuts this short ball. Deliberately so, to miss the man at backward point. Not much power behind the shot, just the guiding over the head of the fielder. Gets a couple
Hazlewood to Sarfaraz, 1 run walks down the pitch, moves across too, pushes a length ball to third man for one
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run outswinger, on a length, driven, but straight to cover-point
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run short of a length, outside off, punched away straight to cover. This is bowled at 143ks
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run bouncer this time, middle and leg, Shehzad ducks it
Hazlewood to Shehzad, no run on a length, good bounce, hits the bat hard. Defended to mid-on
Starc to Sarfaraz, 1 wide angled across him. Left alone. Called a wide although that doesn't look like one to me
Starc to Sarfaraz, 2 runs driven on the up. This is a length ball outside off, doesn't swing, and he punches it past cover, to his right
Starc to Sarfaraz, no run lovely crunchy punch outside off, but straight to cover-point

Starc to Sarfaraz, FOUR runs short of a length, middle and leg, there is no room to swing his arms, but he has somehow short-arm-pulled it past square leg for four. Starc has bowled at 150ks. All that pace has been used here

Starc to Sarfaraz, OUT say what you will of Watson's batting, he is one of the best slip fielders in the world today. This catch is one for the ages. Slip catches are never easy, but the ones that swerve away from you at the last moment? That too to balls bowled at 150.1ks? Sarfraz just follows this quick length ball with his hands, edges it, looks like he has offered an easy catch to Watto until the ball swings away from him at the last moment. Wa

Starc to Haris Sohail, FOUR runs what a way to start your innings in the quarter-final. You have just lost out your matchwinner from the two previous matches in the fifth over, your side is notorious for not batting well, what do you do? You walk out and drive the first ball you face on the up, you drive it so hard, it bounces over the fielder at point
Starc to Haris Sohail, no run bouncer, at 147ks, ducks it

Hazlewood to Shehzad, OUT Pakistan openers are back in the sheds already. Plays a loose shot to a wide length ball. Away from the body with no foot movement. The only thing that moves is the ball. Slightly away from him. Takes a thick edge to the second slip where Clarke takes it easily
Hazlewood to Misbah, no run left alone outside off

Hazlewood to Misbah, no run the bail doesn't come off, but they are also reviewing the lbw. They are not allowing the review, which is just as well for Australia. This is down the leg side, clips the thigh pad, comes back onto the stumps, clips the leg stump, the bail budges, flashes, but comes back down because it is heavier than usual bails. Clarke looks like he wants to review the lbw because he thinks this has hit the pad normally and not the i
Hazlewood to Misbah, 1 wide wide down the leg side
Hazlewood to Misbah, no run length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
Hazlewood to Misbah, no run short of a length, good carry, defended off the back foot
Hazlewood to Misbah, 1 run length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
Starc to Misbah, no run bouncer, 146ks, he ducks it as it is lined outside off
Starc to Misbah, no run length ball, middle and off, no swing, defended back to him
Starc to Misbah, no run squares him up a little as Misbah defends a shortish delivery
Starc to Misbah, no run squared up slightly again as he defends behind square
Starc to Misbah, no run lovely bouncer at 151.4ks. Misbah sways out of its line, drops his wrists, lets it go through
Starc to Misbah, no run another bouncer, at 144ks. He sways out of its line again, dropping his wrists
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run on a length, on off, defended to mid-off
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, on off, punched to cover
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, middle and off, defended off the back foot
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, 2 runs pushed away off the back foot, in front of third man, they come back for two
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run half-volley, driven hard, but straight to cover

Johnson to Misbah, FOUR runs and immediately a false shot. Misbah's mind wants to drive at this full wide ball, but the body hasn't followed. Feet are stuck, the hands don't quite go, but he gets an inside edge to fine leg
Johnson to Misbah, no run full and straight, driven to mid-on
Johnson to Misbah, 1 run pushed into the leg side for a single
Johnson to Haris Sohail, 1 run short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
Johnson to Misbah, 1 wide wide down the leg side
Johnson to Misbah, no run moves across, Johnson angles one across him at 148ks, beats the outside edge as he pushes tentatively
Johnson to Misbah, 1 run across again, bunts a length ball into the leg side for one
Hazlewood to Misbah, no run shuffles across again, covers the outswing, defends to cover

Hazlewood to Misbah, no run this one moves back in exposing the dangers of the movement across. Seams back in from just outside off, but it is bouncing over the stumps. Seems to have rapped him between the unprotected part between the pad and the thigh pad
Hazlewood to Misbah, no run bouncer, outside off, he ducks it
Hazlewood to Misbah, 1 run length ball, angling in, pushed through mid-on, which is unmanned
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, outside off, punched away, but can't beat Warner at backward point
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, no run looks to punch this, is cramped for room, hits it straight to cover
Johnson to Misbah, no run short of a length, quick, hits his arm as he fends
Johnson to Misbah, no run short of a length, outside off, right behind it in defence
Johnson to Misbah, 1 run tucked away off the hip
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run quick, on a length, pretty straight, defended to leg
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run bouncer, pretty quick, he ducks it, but this is hostile, and the bounce is a little variable as this one doesn't come up as much as expected. This is bowled at 152.4ks
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Hazlewood to Misbah, no run on a length, on off, 143ks, defended back to him
Hazlewood to Misbah, 1 run cut away to third man for one
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, FOUR runs there is no mid-off with this ultra-aggressive field, and he has drilled a full ball through that opening
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, 1 run tucked away off the pads for one
Hazlewood to Misbah, 1 run short of a length, into the ribs, nudged away for a single
Hazlewood to Haris Sohail, FOUR runs lovely shot. He opens up the front leg a little, and drives a wide length ball on the up, threading the gap between cover and extra cover
Johnson to Misbah, 1 run wide length ball, runs this down to third man for one
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run on a length, on off, right behind it in defence
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, on off, he is right behind it as he defends it to mid-on
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run looks to steer this to third man but can't beat Warner at backward point

Johnson to Haris Sohail, 1 wide this is called a wide, but Haddin is smiling. This is a mean bouncer, rising from not too short. Damn quick too. Haris wants to pull but can't reach it. This is clocked at 143ks
Johnson to Haris Sohail, 1 run short of a length, pitched outside leg, worked away into the leg side
Johnson to Misbah, no run length ball, angling in from round the wicket, defended back to him
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, 1 run tossed up outside off, pushed to long-off for one
Maxwell to Misbah, 1 run flighted half-volley, driven to long-off
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, no run flat length ball outside off, punched to cover
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, 1 run pushed down to long-off
Maxwell to Misbah, no run flighted around off, pushed back to Maxwell

Maxwell to Misbah, SIX runs tuk tuk goes bang. Every now and then Misbah plays this shot and invariably he connects. Takes this off a length and sends it over deep midwicket. They need these. Can't let Maxwell sneak in soft overs
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, on off, defended back to him
Johnson to Haris Sohail, 1 run short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
Johnson to Misbah, 2 runs moves across to work this shortish ball off the stumps, takes a second
Johnson to Misbah, no run length ball outside off, defended
Johnson to Misbah, no run on a length, angling in, defends this just outside off
Johnson to Misbah, no run strides forward to defend a length ball
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, no run slow offbreak, pushed to cover-point
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, no run stays back to punch a length ball to cover-point
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, no run down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the bat, defends this back to him
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, 1 run overpitched, pushed down to long-on for one
Maxwell to Misbah, no run short of a length, punched away to extra cover
Maxwell to Misbah, no run beats the outside edge as this one doesn't turn back in as expected
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run on a length, holds its line in front of off, defended
Johnson to Haris Sohail, 3 runs full and straight, almost a half-volley, the mid-on is wide, and he pushes it through that vacant area
Johnson to Misbah, no run short of a length, rising into the chest, Misbah is on his toes as he defends
Johnson to Misbah, no run half-volley outside off, driven down the ground, but straight to mid-off
Johnson to Misbah, no run full, just outside off, slower ball, 129ks, Misbah has read this and defends solidly
Johnson to Misbah, 1 run swinging back in as he stays full and outside off, draws a thick inside edge that goes for a single to long leg
Maxwell to Misbah, no run shortish offbreak, defended off the back foot
Maxwell to Misbah, 1 run short again, stays back this time to pull him to deep midwicket
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, no run stays back to a length ball, fails to beat extra cover with the punch
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, no run tossed up outside off, pushed straight to extra cover
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, 1 run down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one

Maxwell to Misbah, SIX runs and Misbah releases pressure. Moves across early to a full ball, gets a full ball, and slogs it over midwicket for six. It is incredible how often he connects them cleanly but how rarely he attempts them
Watson to Haris Sohail, 1 run short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
Watson to Misbah, 1 run length ball outside off, meets it with an open face, gets a single to deep cover
Watson to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
Watson to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, pitches leg, angles towards off, defended with an open face

Watson to Haris Sohail, 1 run impatience from Sohail. Looks to slog this length ball over midwicket, his head falls back as he plays, gets a big top edge that clears backward point and falls short of third man. Misbah has a word with the youngster
Watson to Misbah, 1 run full and straight, worked away for a single to leg
Faulkner to Misbah, 1 run short of a length, on the pads, worked away for one
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, no run length ball, driven on the up, but back to Faulkner
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, angling in towards off, defended with an open face
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, 1 run wide length ball, opens the face, runs it down to third man for one
Faulkner to Misbah, no run short of a length, rising towards the chest, defended with soft hands
Watson to Haris Sohail, no run drives a length ball uppishly, reaches mid-off on the bounce
Watson to Haris Sohail, 2 runs that's a sharp short ball, too sharp for him, hits the glove before the bat comes down in the pull shot, but the lob off the glove has cleared Haddin

Watson to Haris Sohail, FOUR runs Sohail might have mis-hit a couple, but he has made us his mind he is not going to get bogged. Clears the front leg to a length ball, and lofts a length ball over mid-on
Watson to Haris Sohail, 1 run now gets a shortish ball, runs it down to third man for one
Watson to Misbah, no run on a length, on off, defended to leg
Watson to Misbah, no run on a length, on off, defended with an open face
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, 1 run length ball, angling in, worked away to deep midwicket for a single
Faulkner to Misbah, no run on a length, on off, no movement, defended to leg
Faulkner to Misbah, 1 leg bye moves right across his stumps, is beaten and hit on the pad, but the ball is pitched outside leg
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, no run slower ball, overpitched on middle and leg, pushed to short straight midwicket
Faulkner to Haris Sohail, 1 run digs this one in short, he gets tall, runs this down to third man for one
Faulkner to Misbah, 1 run short of a length, on off, shuffles across to work this to leg for a single
Watson to Misbah, no run short of a length, seams in a touch, defended from the crease
Watson to Misbah, no run on a length, in that zone around off, defended from the crease
Watson to Misbah, no run pushes a length ball to short straight cover
Watson to Misbah, no run on a length, again in that zone just outside off, defended back to him
Watson to Misbah, 1 run slightly wider this time, Misbah pushes it wide of cover for a single
Watson to Haris Sohail, 1 run short of a length, on the pads, tucked away square of short fine leg for one
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, 1 run down the wicket to drive this full ball down to long-on

Maxwell to Misbah, OUT oh will you believe it? Maxwell has brought up the breakthrough. Once again no singles for Misbah have meant Pakistan have to take the risks to keep the runs coming. He has previously hit Maxwell out of the attack with two sixes over midwicket, he tries a third one with a slog-sweep. Not quite to the pitch of the ball this time. Fatal. Top edge sits nicely with Finch at deep midwicket. Strange to see a rare hole-out by Misba
Maxwell to Haris Sohail, 1 run down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, 2 runs tossed up outside off, gets some drift away, Akmal drives away from the body, gets a thick edge. Would have gone wide of slip even if it had been there
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run short of a length, turning in, defended to leg
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, 1 run driven to the left of Maxwell who dives and deflects this wide of mid-off for a single
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run length ball outside off, swings back a touch, hits the inside half of the bat
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run short of a length, offcutter, moves away from just outside off, beats his outside edge
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run length ball outside off, allowed to go through to the keeper
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run bouncer, on off, angling away a touch, he ducks under it
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run wide half-volley, driven to third man for one
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run short of a length, rising towards the chest, defended off his toes
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, 2 runs goes back to cut a length ball, places it wide of point for a couple
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run on a length, straight, defended to leg

Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run looks to cut another length ball, but this has come in towards middle and taken the bottom edge, which somehow evades the stumps. Remember what Swann said of cutting offspinners? It's like patting a burning dog
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run defended to midwicket
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run worked with the turn, finds square leg

Maxwell to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs there is an appeal for a hit-wicket, but Akmal is nowhere near the stumps. He has cut this from off, past point, and the bail is off. Haddin, though, has indicated he is not sure and has already gone to the other end even before the replay is shown. It is Haddin's glove that has brought the bail down
Johnson to Haris Sohail, 1 run worked to leg for one
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 3 runs lovely shot, down the wicket, straight of mid-on
Johnson to Haris Sohail, no run that is a sharp bouncer, on middle and leg, angling towards off. Sohail sways out of its line

Johnson to Haris Sohail, OUT the bouncer has done the trick. Johnson has produced the loose drive with leaden feet. Look at his back foot move away as he drives. Johnson pushes this one up, angling it across Sohail, who drives away from the body, his back foot moving away from the line of the ball. The edge is taken
Johnson to Maqsood, no run defended off the front foot
Johnson to Maqsood, 2 runs low full toss, driven wide of cover
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, 1 run bunted past cover for one
Maxwell to Maqsood, 1 run looks to work this to leg but finds midwicket
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run defends an offbreak to leg
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, 1 run pushed down to long-on for a single
Maxwell to Maqsood, 1 run another single to long-on
Maxwell to Umar Akmal, no run this one holds its line outside off, or rather doesn't turn as much as expected. Beats the outside edge

Johnson to Afridi, SIX runs that's No. 351. Oh Shahid, what an entertainer. Length ball, just outside off, he drives with an open face, Finch thinks he is in business at deep point but it sails over it
Johnson to Afridi, no run slower offcutter, Afridi is off pace with this, pushes defensively, is beaten
Johnson to Afridi, 1 run on a length, outside off, runs this down to third man for one
Johnson to Maqsood, no run short of a length, on off, looks to work this to leg, late into the shot and ends up defending this back to Johnson
Johnson to Maqsood, no run slower bouncer, Maqsood is early into the shot, is hit in the armpit
Johnson to Maqsood, 2 runs short of a length, worked past midwicket for a couple
Hazlewood to Afridi, no run short ball outside off, Afridi looks to pull this in front of square, is early into the pull and is beaten
Hazlewood to Afridi, no run looks to run this down to third man from just outside off. Opens the face pretty early. Is beaten

Hazlewood to Afridi, FOUR runs Afridi slashes hard, gets a top edge, and it flies over the keeper's head. This is quite a safe shot. He has given this pull shot his all. More often than not these edges fly safe nowadays
Hazlewood to Afridi, 1 run moves across to work a low full toss into the leg side
Hazlewood to Maqsood, 1 run cut away with both his feet in the air, gets a single to third man

Hazlewood to Afridi, OUT he has found out deep midwicket. Finch has taken three deep midwicket catches today. Oh that short square boundary, what a temptress. Afridi looks to pull, but the ball is not short enough. He doesn't get all of it, Finch is prowling there, and takes this head high. Is this the last time Lala has paced off the field with gloves and pads on?
Starc to Maqsood, no run short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
Starc to Maqsood, no run wide length ball, angling away, he throws his bat it, and is beaten by the angle
Starc to Maqsood, no run on a length, outside off, defended to mid-off
Starc to Maqsood, 2 runs yorker outside off, squeezed past backward point
Starc to Maqsood, 1 run short-arm pull to deep midwicket for one
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run pushes at a full ball tentatively, is beaten by the angle
Faulkner to Maqsood, no run short of a length, outside off, punched to mid-off
Faulkner to Maqsood, no run full ball, driven straight to short cover
Faulkner to Maqsood, no run slower offcutter, overpitched, driven to mid-on
Faulkner to Maqsood, no run short of a length, at the stumps, punched back at him
Faulkner to Maqsood, no run full, on off, driven with an open face, but straight to extra cover
Faulkner to Maqsood, 1 run short of a length, punched back at him. Faulkner misfields to allow a single that breaks the maiden
Starc to Maqsood, 2 runs moves across to work a length ball in front of deep midwicket
Starc to Maqsood, 1 run nearly another wicket for Starc. Short of a length, gets big on Maqsood who tries to flick this to leg. Top edge falls clear of midwicket
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run yorker, dipping, swinging away, beats the outside edge of the bat
Starc to Wahab Riaz, 1 run short of a length, on the pads, allows the easy single
Starc to Maqsood, 1 run driven on the up, the first blemish in the field for Australia as Warner lets it through at backward point
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run full and outside off, swinging away, beats the push
Faulkner to Maqsood, 1 run length ball outside off, driven to deep cover for one
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run angled across, and he is beaten on the outside edge again. Not quite getting behind the line of the ball
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run and he beats his bat with an angled full ball again
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run short of a length, angled across, Wahab tries to open the face for a single. Beaten on the outer edge again
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run on a length, holds its line around off, defended back to him
Starc to Maqsood, no run full and straight, hit straight to extra cover
Starc to Maqsood, no run bouncer from wide on the crease, beats his attempt at the hook
Starc to Maqsood, 1 wide lovely bowling. Sees him back away and bowls a yorker on the tram line. Oh come on. Marais Erasmus has called this a wide. Cut the bowlers some slack, ump
Starc to Maqsood, 1 run full outside off, driven to third man for one
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run wide full ball, swinging away, beats the outside edge
Starc to Wahab Riaz, 1 run and another yorker. This is straight at the stumps. Outside edge saves him. They get a single to point
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, FOUR runs and he makes room and swings a length ball through mid-on for four
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run swings and misses here
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, no run sees him give the charge and bounces him at 141ks. Riaz is swaying out of the line hoping it doesn't hit him
Faulkner to Wahab Riaz, 5 runs short of a length, at the chest, fended away for one. A silly shy at the stumps from Johnson, and they concede four extra runs
Faulkner to Maqsood, 2 runs slower ball, legcutter, driven down the ground
Faulkner to Maqsood, no run full, on off, driven hard straight to mid-off
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run Wahab gets a touch on that little white thing, the low full toss, gets an edge to the keeper. On the bounce
Starc to Wahab Riaz, FOUR runs that little white thing has gone to the wide long-on boundary. Wahab makes room, Starc follows him with a full ball, Riaz whips it without a back lift, clears midwicket
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run bouncer at 150ks. Good response from Starc. Riaz gets under the ball
Starc to Wahab Riaz, 1 run yorker outside off, dug out for a single
Starc to Maqsood, no run moves across to push a low full toss straight to mid-on
Starc to Maqsood, 1 run short of a length, angling in, pushed into the off side for a single
Hazlewood to Maqsood, no run short of a length, on off, punched to mid-off
Hazlewood to Maqsood, no run looks for the sweep from outside off, looking to go square, gets a thick inside edge onto the pad

Hazlewood to Maqsood, OUT good shot but he had found the fielder. Full ball, on off, he knows there is no deep cover, he is looking to drive over the ring, just gets too close to the pitch of the ball, and finds Johnson at cover
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, no run short of a length, just outside off, beats the outside edge
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, no run full, just outside off, pushed to point with an open face
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Starc to Wahab Riaz, no run he is full and outside off, and he beats the bat again as this holds its line against the angle

Starc to Wahab Riaz, OUT Starc is the sole leading wicket-taker this World Cup. Finally he has drawn an edge. Riaz has finally hit that little white thing after backing away from the stumps. The outside edge settles nicely with Haddin
Starc to Sohail Khan, 2 runs full, angling in, he gets the bat down in time, and gets a couple wide of midwicket. Just in time the bat comes down
Starc to Sohail Khan, no run bouncer, angling in, this time he ducks under it
Starc to Sohail Khan, no run yorker outside off, squeezes under the bat
Starc to Sohail Khan, 2 runs length ball, angling in, nicely guided past midwicket
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, no run length ball outside off, moves across to defend
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, no run short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, 2 runs full, swinging in, worked to long leg. Good running brings them the second
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, no run short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
Hazlewood to Ehsan Adil, 1 run full, swinging in, too straight, goes for a leg-bye

Hazlewood to Sohail Khan, OUT Hazlewood ends with four in the quarter-final. Sohail backs away and swings. Gets a massive top edge that goes a million miles and comes down towards gully. Haddin the man with mitts on clears the area, settles under it, keeps his eyes on the swirling ball, and takes a safe catch
Starc to Rahat Ali, no run yorker, on off, Rahat keeps it out
Starc to Rahat Ali, no run bouncer, angling in, he ducks under it
Starc to Rahat Ali, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Starc to Rahat Ali, no run full toss outside off, swinging away, beats the outside edge
Starc to Rahat Ali, 1 run full, angling in to off, he stays back and brings the bat down. The outside edge rolls wide of third slip

Starc to Ehsan Adil, no run falls short of what could have been the 19th wicket for Starc. Now he will have to wait for SCG. This is full and straight, he stays back, is squared up, edges it softly, and it falls short of the diving second slip
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, no run short of a length, angling away, beats the outside edge
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, no run short of a length, angling away, beats the cut this time
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, 1 run slower legcutter, runs off the thick outside edge for a single to point
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, no run short of a length, on off, defended to leg
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, 2 runs short of a length, tucked away off the hip with soft hands, gets a couple
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, 1 run full outside off, played with open face to deep point for a single
Johnson to Maqsood, 1 run short of a length, on off, worked to leg for one
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run on a length, on off, defended with an open face
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run full and wide, driven back at Johnson
Johnson to Umar Akmal, no run on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
Johnson to Umar Akmal, FOUR runs driven on the up after moving across to cover the line of the ball. Placed straight of mid-off
Johnson to Umar Akmal, 1 run slower offcutter, on the pads, worked away

Maxwell to Umar Akmal, OUT what have you done Umar Akmal? This is a long hop at the Adelaide Oval with short square boundaries. Akmal has enough time to pause, do a quick opinion poll on where to hit this in the stands, and then take a selfie before hitting it. Unfortunately for him, he has found out the one man stationed there. Aaron Finch hasn't had to move an inch. Akmal is disgusted with himself. Smashes the bat into his pad
Maxwell to Afridi, 2 runs paddle-sweeps this fine of short fine leg
Maxwell to Afridi, FOUR runs drives hard at a tossed-up half-volley, slices it over backward point
Maxwell to Afridi, no run defended to mid-off
Maxwell to Afridi, no run flicked to midwicket
Maxwell to Afridi, FOUR runs Afridi is down the wicket and drills this length ball straight of long-off for four
Watson to Ehsan Adil, 1 run length ball outside off, defended with an open face
Watson to Rahat Ali, 1 run length ball outside off, bunted for a single to point
Watson to Ehsan Adil, no run on a length, pretty straight, defended to mid-off
Watson to Ehsan Adil, 1 run Watson slips in a sharp bouncer. Adil manages to keep the pull shot down for a single
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run full, angling in, pushed to mid-on
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run short of a length, seaming in, cramps him up for room. Defended
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, no run full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, no run short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, 1 run on a length, outside off, gets a single to mid-off
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, no run short of a length, on off, makes room to slash, and is beaten
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, no run on a length, no room, gets a thick leading edge towards cover
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, 1 run he makes room and swings, gets a thick edge that clears the cover ring
Johnson to Maqsood, no run length ball, pushed on the up, to long-off

Johnson to Maqsood, no run nearly an exceptional return catch. Short of a length, into the ribs, Maqsood looks to fend this to leg, gets a leading edge to his left. This is a soft leading edge, Johnson has enough time to go to his left and take it one-handed. Except that he has to go against the angle. He gets a hand to it, but can't hang on
Johnson to Maqsood, no run into the ribs again, at 144.4 ks, defended to leg
Johnson to Maqsood, no run full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
Johnson to Maqsood, 1 run tucked away off the hip for a single
Johnson to Afridi, no run wide half-volley, Afridi's bottom hand comes off as he drives. Finds the man at point
Hazlewood to Maqsood, 2 runs short of a length, looks to punch it, gets a thick edge to third man
Hazlewood to Maqsood, no run short of a length, outside off, punched to point
Hazlewood to Maqsood, 1 run shuffles across to punch this to deep cover for one
Hazlewood to Afridi, 1 run deft touch by Afridi after winding up for a big hit. Runs this off the face of the bat over slip for one
Hazlewood to Maqsood, no run short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
Hazlewood to Maqsood, FOUR runs Maqsood counterattacks. Shuffles across to a length ball, gets under it, and lofts it over mid-on for four
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run bouncer, he makes room and tries to pull. Beaten by the height of it
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run another bouncer, and beats the top edge once again as he backs away
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run short again, hurries onto him, the pull ends up going to cover. Doesn't carry
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run full and straight this time, there is no room, Rahat keeps it out
Watson to Rahat Ali, no run short of a length, makes room to swing into the leg side, and is beaten by the angle that cramps him up
Watson to Rahat Ali, 1 run looks for the yorker, which swings in, but concedes a single off the inside edge
Faulkner to Rahat Ali, 1 run makes room to try to slog one to leg, gets a bottom edge for a single
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, FOUR runs that had come out of nowhere. First boundary in exactly nine overs. Faulkner bowls length with mid-on up, and he clears the front leg to clear that man
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, no run tries the same shot this time but Faulkner slips in a bouncer to beat him
Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, 2 runs moves all over the crease before coming back to his normal stance, and edges this back over the bowler's head for a couple

Faulkner to Ehsan Adil, OUT this time it has gone to hand. Faulkner gets a wicket, Starc takes a lovely catch. Clears the front let to pull, gets a top edge towards top edge, Starc rushes in and takes this low and diving forward

Pakistan's batsmen once again brought pressure upon themselves. Loose shots at the top, slow going in the middle, resulting in low-percentage cricket. Their batting needs a revolution. How long can they keep asking their bowlers to bail them out? For all their bowling greatness in the '90s, we must not forget that the likes of Saeed Anwar and Inzamam and Mohammad Yousuf were quite modern for that time. They were possibly ahead of the curve. This Pakistan

5.33pm The Australian bowlers have done their job. Some excellent aggressive bowling from them. Starc is back on top of the tree. Hazlewood has proven his line and length is a better pick than Cummins in a team of two other express quick bowlers. Johnson has shown signs of the return of some of the menace. Maxwell produced two crucial wickets in the middle. Faulkner was exceptional in the batting Powerplay and in the end. When Watson bowls five overs for

While we await the two canaries in the coal mine to face the green men, here's an official request for your #politeenquiries. Not here, you understand - although I'm happy to field the odd question - but on Twitter, where the mellifluous Melinda Farrell and handy Andy Zaltzman will be ready with their butterfly nets...
Sohail Khan has the first new ball in hand... Here we go
Sohail Khan to Warner, no run starts over the wicket, pitched up and shaping a touch on off stump, Warner leans into a punchy drive, straight to extra cover
Sohail Khan to Warner, no run full length again, swinging back a touch and Warner chops the ball on to his front pad, little loose but he gets away with it

Sohail Khan to Warner, FOUR runs lovely timing, just a tickle coming forwards, basically Warner has defended this on the up and beat the fielder, who only had a yard or two to move, it races to the boundary for the first four of the innings
Sohail Khan to Warner, 3 runs Sohail is pitching the ball up, looking for any movement on offer, Warner is quick to tuck in again, gets this straight back past the bowler but mid-on gives chase

Sohail Khan to Finch, no run first ball to Finch, nip-backer from Sohail and he's interested, the ball loops to slip but there was not bat involved... Dharmasena gives a serene shake of the head and Misbah decides not to gamble. Looked a little high, Hawk-Eye says it would have just clipped the top of off
Sohail Khan to Finch, no run length ball around the line of off, Finch taps it defensively into the covers
Ehsan Adil to Warner, 2 runs touch straight to begin with, length ball pinged off the pads by the effervescent Warner, gets a couple through midwicket
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run pushes this wider, angling away from the left-hander, plinks it off the toe of the bat towards point
Ehsan Adil to Warner, FOUR runs slashed but slashed hard, Warner's railway sleeper of a bat gets a chunk of the ball, flies over the head of second slip and away
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run fullish, around the line of off, comes forward and blocks into the covers
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run full and wide of the stumps, Warner frees the arms menacingly and hammers the ball along the ground to extra cover
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run length ball on middle and off, Warner stays back and whips it to the on side, picks out mid-on this time
Sohail Khan to Finch, 2 runs length ball in the channel outside off, Finch shuffles across, punches it on the up and picks a gap in the covers
Sohail Khan to Finch, no run decent line, comes forward and blocks to the off side

Sohail Khan to Finch, OUT pitched up, this jags back at Finch and raps him on the pads, Sohail implores for the decision... and Dharmasena gives it! Finch, after a brief conversation with his partner, asks for the review but it only takes a quick look to release this was foolishness. Not much footwork and the ball zipped in with the arm, past the inside edge as he played to leg, and it was crashing into the woodwork halfway up. The finger points sk
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run touch shorter to begin with, outside off stump, Smith gets across to defend
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run pitched up a little more, coming back into the right-hander, Smith closes the face and nudges to midwicket
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run length ball around the line of off, gets across and shows it a solid straight bat in defence
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run stays back and pushes defensively into the off side
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run length delviery, pushed across, Warner covers up in front of off stump
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run angled across in the channel outside off, Warner cocks the triggers but mishits into the covers
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run offered width again, tries to crash it through the off side but again fails to connect properly
Ehsan Adil to Warner, 2 runs punched off the back foot, that's out of the meat, nicely played in front of backward point and he gets a couple
Ehsan Adil to Warner, no run pitched up, inviting the drive and Warner is a man that doesn't need much invitation, slaps it straight to Umar Akmal who fields it cool as you like in the covers
Sohail Khan to Smith, FOUR runs pitched up and tailing in on the stumps, a la Finch's dismissal, Smith plays those in his sleep, though, flicking a leg glance through square for four
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run length and in the corridor, nibbles away from the batsman, who is happy to leave
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run gets across in front of off stump and pushes the ball back towards mid-on
Sohail Khan to Smith, 1 run good length, well outside off but Smith still turns it to leg, works it wide of mid-on for a single
Sohail Khan to Warner, no run Sohail fires this across Warner's bows, chops it into the ground and it bobbles towards cover
Sohail Khan to Warner, 1 run slightly back of a length, on the stumps, swivels the hips and flicks one through midwicket
Rahat Ali to Warner, FOUR runs starts with a gentle half-tracker and Warner crunches it high over the covers and away for four. Er, we'll call that a loosener
Rahat Ali to Warner, 1 run still a touch short and this one veering towards leg, nudged off the hips for a single
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run continues over the wicket to Smith, back of a length and defended from the crease
Rahat Ali to Smith, FOUR runs too full, Rahat gives up another four ball, in the channel and Smith shows he can play the cover drive too, stroke it through the infield and away
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run better length, outside off, brings down a straight bat and pushes to mid-off
Rahat Ali to Smith, 3 runs walks to the off side, Rahat pitches full on middle and is whipped away for three more, Smith likes it there, wristy nudge through midwicket
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run touch full and well outside off, making sure Smith can't get it off his pads, left alone
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run similar line, gets on to the front foot and taps defensively into the covers
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run short ball from Sohail, doesn't get up quite as Smith is expecting, bottom edges a pull down on the pitch

Sohail Khan to Smith, FOUR runs shot! Full outside off, just a half-step into the ball and then the wrists come through, cracks four through extra cover. Another boundary for Smith, who's made a smooth start
Sohail Khan to Smith, 1 run shortens his length, straighter line and Smith gets out his big spoon, happily nurdles away to the leg side
Sohail Khan to Warner, no run length ball outside off, Warner dabs into the off side from the crease
Rahat Ali to Smith, 2 runs good pace from Rahat, up above 140pkh, Smith uses that to work the ball through square for a couple
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run goes back and across and defends down the track
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run fullish, in the channel, gets on the front foot and defends
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run slightly back of a length, pushed across from over the wicket, Smith hops back and chops the ball towards mid-off
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run length delivery, decent line around off stump, Smith steers the ball in front of square
Rahat Ali to Smith, 2 runs nicely played, back-foot punch and he gets the ball between extra cover and mid-off, Misbah gives chase but Smith gets a comfortable two
Wahab Riaz to Warner, 3 runs over the wicket, shortish and a little wide, Warner latches on to it but his cut doesn't quite connect, still nearly runs all the way
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run back of a length at the body, nudged behind square
Wahab Riaz to Warner, 1 wide wild, down the leg side and Warner whirls his arms at a pull in vain
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, no run short and angled across, Wahab's hitting 145kph already, left alone
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 2 runs straighter line, Clarke shuffles across and clips a couple firmly through midwicket to get going
Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 run slightly back of a length, in the channel, Clarke hangs back and steers a single to third man
Rahat Ali to Clarke, no run bangs this in halfway down, doesn't get up that much and Clarke defends softly on to the pitch
Rahat Ali to Clarke, 2 runs on the stumps and a touch short, works this away through square
Rahat Ali to Clarke, no run continues to drop short, 140kph and over middle and off, Clarke squares up and defends back to the bowler
Rahat Ali to Clarke, no run goes fuller now, around the line of off, shows it the maker's name in defence
Rahat Ali to Clarke, no run pitched up around middle and off, Clarke punches along the ground to mid-on
Rahat Ali to Clarke, 2 runs bit of width, pushed across on a length, hangs back and swats a couple wide of third man
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run shortish and pulled into the ground through square

Wahab Riaz to Clarke, 1 run back of a length and this gets big on Clarke, who gets on top of it, drops the ball behind backward point and calls for the run, Smith has to get motoring but Ahmed Shahzad's throw misses. Would have been in anyway
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run banged in at the body, Smith paddles it around the corner for one more

Wahab Riaz to Clarke, OUT gottim! The short ball works, Clarke dollies it to forward short leg! Don't you love it when a plan comes together... That was well-directed from Wahab, not quite a snorter but awkward enough for a man with an antique spine, rising towards the helmet grill and Clarke can only pop it up off the splice, floats into the hands of the catcher. Maqsood hurls the ball at the floor and screams in delight. Pakistan are in this
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run slams the ball in short and Watson has to take evasive action, fiery stuff

Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run length this time, 150kph and Watson shapes to play and then raises the bat out of the way... Wahab glares at him for one, two, three seconds, then starts loudly applauding his team-mates
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run slanted across the right-hander from over the wicket, shaping away off a length and no stroke offered
Rahat Ali to Smith, 1 run goes across and works a length ball through the leg side
Rahat Ali to Watson, 1 run length ball and this seams a touch as Watson hangs back, wanted to turn to leg but skips off the edge through gully
Rahat Ali to Smith, FOUR runs lovely stuff from Smiffy, calm as you like, waits for the slightly full delivery and then caresses it through the covers, too much gas for Misbah in the end
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run good length, drops back and pushes into the off side
Rahat Ali to Smith, 1 run Rahat has a FSL in now as well, Smith teases him by working a bouncer down and away behind square
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run steams in, short and rising, worked away through square off the back foot
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run dug in, spits at Watson, he limbos away, jerking his head at the last minute... Wahab is bringing the heat, as advertised
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run short again, this time a touch leg side and Watson flinches almost involuntarily... Dharmasena doesn't call wide, either
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run back of a length, 150kph/93mph and blocked solidly off the back foot
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run on the stumps, fast and accurate, again Watson defends

Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run a ripper, so close to the glove! Just a fraction short and skidding on at a horrible angle, Watson spasms in the crease but just manages to drop his hands out of the way. Terrific stuff from Wahab
Afridi to Smith, no run floated up outside off stump, Smith prods into the covers
Afridi to Smith, 1 run the googly this time, not sure Smith picked it, an inside edge squirts behind square on the leg side
Afridi to Watson, 1 run a touch short - not what you want to see if you're standing where Misbah is - topsinner from Afridi and Watson rocks back to pull one to deep midwicket
Afridi to Smith, 2 runs length outside off, skids on and driven through the covers to the sweeper
Afridi to Smith, 1 run floated up a bit further, drifting towards middle and leg, Smith whips one to long-on
Afridi to Watson, no run tossed up and Watson pushes back on the off side from the crease
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run shortish and stabbed away, Maqsood reacts well at short leg to move to his right and cut the ball off
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run length outside off, still hitting 150kph after the break, blocked into the off side
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run short and pulled into the ground down through backward square

Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run god golly, that's a helluva ball, Watson does well to keep it down and away from the catcher on the leg side, climbing from just back of a length and thudding into the splice as the batsman threw his hands up
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run banged in again and this loops towards short leg, won't quite carry! The barrage from Wahab is unrelenting, again had Watson hopping around like a man on coals
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run short and rising to catch the shoulder of the bat, this flies over the cordon but short of the third man! Serious working over for Watson but he survies
Afridi to Watson, no run pushed through around off stump, tapped back towards mid-off
Afridi to Watson, 1 run walks out and punches a single along the ground to long-on

Afridi to Smith, FOUR runs floated up around the line of off and clipped for four, quick hands from Smith and not afraid to hit against the turn, no one out at deep midwicket and that is a welcome boundary
Afridi to Smith, 2 runs works this past midwicket again but long-on has moved around and prevents another four
Afridi to Smith, no run tossed up and punched into the covers
Afridi to Smith, 2 runs full and on the stumps, again Smith closes the face to send the ball scuttling into a gap square on the leg side

Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run bounced him out, Wahab's plan works a treat... except for Rahat dropping the ball! Oh dear, oh dear, Rahat, what have you done? Straight down the throat of fine leg, Watson never in control of a wild hook but the fielder butchers it. Wahab bellows in frustration, could be a huge moment
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run angled across, length ball blocked from the crease
Wahab Riaz to Smith, no run shortish outside off, Smith defends down the track to the bowler... and Wahab throws down the stumps in frustration
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run charges in once again, hits the deck hard and Smith deals with a rising ball around his ribcage, works one through square
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 wide vicious lifter from Wahab, ever-so-slightly leg side and Watson gets his equipment out of the way... signalled wide and that's means an extra ball for Watto to survive
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run close again! Watson is being peppered, again takes his eyes off it, hits high up the bat as he fends away the offending delivery, short of the catcher
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 2 runs pitches this up, aiming for leg-before, Watson has steeled himself and works a couple off his pads
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run length ball on the stumps, tapped short on the leg side
Sohail Khan to Smith, 1 run slightly short, hangs back and punches to the right of extra cover, takes the pace off it but can't prevent a run
Sohail Khan to Watson, FOUR runs half-tracker from Sohail, following Wahab's lead but without the venom, Watson rolls his wrists and clatters four in front of deep square leg
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run touch short but in the channel outside off, played into the covers
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run that's a better bouncer, climbing above shoulder height as it whirs back at Watson, only 137kph but beats the attempted pull
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run banged in even shorter, all height and no trousers, really, and Watson swerves under it
Wahab Riaz to Smith, 1 run back of a length, 147kph and Smith gets in line, turns behind square
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run another grumpy bumper from furious Wahab, hits the splice as Watson clings on to his batting existence
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 wide slammed in short, very short and called wide as it sails over the batsman...
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run lets this go a little early, maybe attempting to trap Watson on the crease with a yorker, bunts the full toss back along the ground
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 wide short and wanged down the leg side, Wahab losing his line a touch, maybe flagging
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 2 runs dug in at the body, this time Watson gets on top of it and turns the ball down behind square for runs
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run straight, on a length, gets half forwards and nudges to the leg side
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run shortish and Watson takes it on the thigh pad, back in the crease... Some of the fire has been doused, could be Wahab's last
Sohail Khan to Smith, no run good length, Smith comes forward to block
Sohail Khan to Smith, 1 run back and across and nudges one through square leg

Sohail Khan to Watson, FOUR runs touch too full from Sohail, in the slot for Watson to cream a drive, all his Wahab troubles forgotten, beats the despairing dive from Misbah and runs away to the cover boundary
Sohail Khan to Watson, 2 runs full length and tailing towards the pads, Watto clips a couple more through midwicket
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run off stump, goodish length, Watson plants the front foot and defends
Sohail Khan to Watson, 1 run pitched up on the stumps, hasn't got the pace to discomfit the batsman, glanced behind square
Rahat Ali to Watson, no run length outside off, Watson mistimes a chop into the covers
Rahat Ali to Watson, no run comes forward and punches the ball towards mid-off on the up
Rahat Ali to Watson, 1 run angled across, slightly back of a length and steered through point for a single
Rahat Ali to Smith, 1 wide sliding across the batsman, looked just about inside the tramlines... but called wide as Smith ignores it

Rahat Ali to Smith, FOUR runs pitched up in the channel, Smith strokes another boundary, pinged through extra cover giving the man in the deep no chance... Raise of the bat for fifty, been a silky knock
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run touch short, around off stump, jabbed back towards the bowler
Rahat Ali to Smith, no run pushed towards the slips and Smith taps into the off side coming forwards
Sohail Khan to Watson, FOUR runs short and sitting up outside off, Watson bullies this away for four, front-foot pull and it goes off the bat with a crack through midwicket
Sohail Khan to Watson, 1 wide Sohail gives up some more loose change, boinging this halfway down and way over the batsman's head

Sohail Khan to Watson, 1 wide well, this is daft... he's not going to get out if he can't hit them. Pakistan have got carried away with Wahab's success against Watson and Sohail slams another one in that rises too high
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run better length, still short and climbing towards the throat, defended on the back foot
Sohail Khan to Watson, FOUR runs short ball, skidding through the body but made to look like a long hop by Watson, wheels a pull away and beats fine leg, four more
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run length outside off and pushed back to mid-off
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run now that's a bit smarter, slips in the yorker and Watson nearly overbalances, digs it out to midwicket
Sohail Khan to Watson, 1 run slightly short, outside off, plays through the line and picks up one through the covers
Haris Sohail to Watson, 1 run floated up outside off from around the wicket, drilled to long-off
Haris Sohail to Smith, 1 run drops a little short, wide of the stumps and cut off the back foot through point
Haris Sohail to Watson, no run short again, Watson hangs back and clatters it to extra cover
Haris Sohail to Watson, no run gives this some air, floated towards off stump, leans out to defend
Haris Sohail to Watson, 1 run some turn? Flighted from Sohail, around off stump and straightens to clips the edge as Watson pushes forwards, runs behind square
Haris Sohail to Smith, no run tossed up and drifting to leg, Smith flicks at it, runs off the pad, I think, to short fine leg
Afridi to Watson, 1 run drops a little short, Watson pulls through midwicket
Afridi to Smith, 1 run pushed through on middle and leg, clipped square for a single
Afridi to Watson, 2 runs sliding on with the arm towards leg stump, guided away off the pads behind square
Afridi to Watson, 3 runs short from Afridi, not got that zip off the surface as yet, Watson crunches a meaty pull down the ground, cut off at long-on
Afridi to Smith, 1 run flighted, comes forward, taps one more through mid-on
Afridi to Watson, 1 run tossed up, googly on leg stump, worked with the turn (such as it is) to deep square leg
Haris Sohail to Watson, no run tossed up, played back to the bowler coming forwards
Haris Sohail to Watson, 1 run length ball, straightening a fraction outside off, punched down the ground to long-off
Haris Sohail to Smith, 1 run floated up on the stumps, Smith dinks one more back past the bowler
Haris Sohail to Watson, 1 run very full, gets forward and boshes another single to long-on
Haris Sohail to Smith, no run flighted, gets Smith reaching around his front pad, pushed back to the bowler a little uncertainly
Haris Sohail to Smith, 1 run flatter and swatted away through the covers for the fourth single from the over
Afridi to Smith, no run angled in with the arm, can't get this one away
Afridi to Smith, no run skidding on and pushed back
Afridi to Smith, FOUR runs flat on middle stump, Smith gets to the pitch of it anyway and clubs towards long-on, which is vacant, bounces just before the rope
Afridi to Smith, no run touch short on the stumps, trapped to leg from the crease
Afridi to Smith, 2 runs flighted outside off, leans out and steers a couple more through the covers
Afridi to Smith, 1 run tossed up, luring Smith out and then it dips on him, done in the flight but he manages to thrust his hands out and prevent it slipping past
Ehsan Adil to Smith, 1 run slightly short of a length, popped into the leg side, aerial shot from Smith but into a gap
Ehsan Adil to Watson, 1 run slightly short again, outside off, chopped to backward point where Shahzad makes a smart diving stop but can't prevent one
Ehsan Adil to Smith, no run back of a length, around off stump, blocked

Ehsan Adil to Smith, OUT fuller, on the stumps, Smith flicks and misses - given! Adil's appeal was almost a lone one, though Sarfraz also went up, Dharmasena gave it some thought before raising the finger. Australia have used their review, so Smith has to trudge off, having looked impenetrable for the last couple of hours. Looked like it would have clipped leg, fairly innocuous ball, Smith not quite as focused as he had been
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, 1 run length on off stump, Maxwell is busy already, pushes at it, opens the face and runs one to third man to get off and running
Ehsan Adil to Watson, no run parsimonious length on off stump, Watson guards his wicket like a sentry
Rahat Ali to Maxwell, no run decent line to begin with, Maxwell avoids getting funky, dabs into the covers
Rahat Ali to Maxwell, no run goodish length around off stump, prodded carefully back on the off side
Rahat Ali to Maxwell, no run pitched up outside off, nice and juicy and Maxwell throws the bat, think the toe hit the ground, there was a sound as it zipped through but Erasmus wasn't interested
Rahat Ali to Maxwell, no run length ball around off, 140kph and a tight line, pushed away defensively this time
Rahat Ali to Maxwell, no run straighter and hit on the pads, caught him on the move but probably a little high
Rahat Ali to Maxwell, FOUR runs super shot, timed the pants off that, touch full from Rahat and Maxwell stroked it back past mid-off, first boundary for him
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run charges in, Watto can see the whites of his eyes from 22 yards away, back of a length and jabbed into the covers

Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 2 runs banged in, Maxwell flaps at it, massive miscue, halfway between a ramp and a top-edged saucapan swat, flies way up, down towards third man - but Sohail Khan drops it on the run! Barely gets a hand on it before stumbling over, Wahab screams in anguish for the second time tonight
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, no run more chin music, Maxwell decides not to take this one
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 1 wide length ball, fired down the leg side, Maxwell swings at it anyway
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 1 run rising off a length, shuffles back and across, pushed into the covers for one
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run length ball on the stumps, clipped of the pads past square leg
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 1 run shortish, worked off the body into the leg side
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, no run back of a length, cramps Maxwell as he tries to force of the back foot, a whisker away from his outside edge
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, no run outside off, length this time, pushed into the off side
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, no run length ball in the channel, driven on the up to the man at cover
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, FOUR runs this is just a smidge short but Maxwell contorts himself and manufactures a shovelled-pull through midwicket, in the air but no one there and he gets fours
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, 1 run length outside off, Maxwell reaches for the drive, hits high up the bat but falls short of short extra cover and deflects for one
Ehsan Adil to Watson, FOUR runs touch full, in the corridor but Watson is far from uncertain, plants his tree trunk and belabours a cover drive to the boundary
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, FOUR runs pitched up on leg stump, not quite the yorker and Maxwell times it supremely off his toes for four through mdiwicket
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, FOUR runs steps to leg, Wahab follows him, drops short and Maxwell somehow blaps it through backward point, sort of a tennis shot, totally off balance and yet is whistles away
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 1 run bangs this in short, rolls the wrists on a pull, gloves behind square for one
Wahab Riaz to Watson, 1 run drops back outside off and guides a single off an open bat face
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, no run bouncer from Wahab, Maxwell tries to chop down the beanstalk, fails to connect
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 1 wide back of a length again, very leg side... Wahab tiring, I think
Wahab Riaz to Maxwell, 2 runs goes full and outside the line of off, Maxwell stays still and drills a couple more out to deep extra cover
Ehsan Adil to Watson, 1 run slower ball from Adil, dips on Watson but he's waiting, slaps it to midwicket and jogs through to complete his half-century
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, no run slightly full outside off, Maxwell's arms were born free but he carves the ball to cover
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, no run pitched up and defended on the front foot, into the ground and Adil leaps to get a hand on it
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, no run fullish and straight, dances across and pings the ball to mid-on
Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, FOUR runs dismissive from Maxwell, little bit of width and he crunches the ball on the up, sails in front of extra cover and away for four

Ehsan Adil to Maxwell, SIX runs short ball, Maxwell takes the bait, there's a man out there... but he'd need to be in the crowd. Effortless swivel-pulled six to finish the over and kick Pakistan in the bojangles once more
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run shortish, stays back and blocks to the leg side
Wahab Riaz to Watson, SIX runs there is it, the symbol of victory, Watson takes on the Wahab bouncer and this time nails it into the crowd, over the head of deep square leg. No coming back from here
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run good length on off stump and Watson defends this, almost theatrically, back to the bowler
Wahab Riaz to Watson, FOUR runs veers leg side, back of a length and tickled fine, wide of the keeper and that will run away. Coming in a flood now, Pakistan's World Cup ebbing away
Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run dug in short, outside off stump, Watson gets on top of it and defends to the off side

Wahab Riaz to Watson, no run rapid bumper to finish, Watson ducks the challenge and then gets mouthful of filth from Wahab, who came all the way down to congratulate Australia on their semi-final place pass on his thoughts. Watson chuckles like a baby with a rattle
Sohail Khan to Maxwell, 2 runs full and homing on middle and leg stump, glanced fine for a couple
Sohail Khan to Maxwell, SIX runs outrageous. But since it's Maxwell, maybe just run of the mill... Full outside off, Maxwell crouches and scoop-slaps the ball into the stands at deep backward point
Sohail Khan to Maxwell, 1 run slower ball on leg stump, spots it and deflects on behind square
Sohail Khan to Watson, no run pitched up in the channel, driven into the ground, over the bowler's head, Watson sends Maxwell back as mid-off fields

Sohail Khan to Watson, FOUR runs fullish length outside off, driven into a gap, the field is up, Watson raises his arms in celebration... Australia have won by six wickets and will take their place in the last four. It was only briefly in doubt when Wahab Riaz was putting a hex on Watson but two dropped catches off his bowling snuffed out Pakistan's faint hopes
Australia won by 6 wickets (with 97 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Josh Hazlewood, AUS
